Description: Warriors are highly trained combat experts
Proficiency Requirements: You have Proficiency in Athletics, Acrobatics and a number of extra Proficiencies equal to your Intelligence.

~Proficiency in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Proficiency in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.

Proficiencies Description: Your physical training as a Warrior provides you with enough practice and muscle memory to be able to succeed at the more difficult hand-to-hand tasks, such as swimming, lifting and jumping.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back when you Long Rest.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells (not Talents) when taking a Long Rest.
Spellcasting.Other: All Warrior-specific Abilities are not considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).

~Advanced Flank~.Effect:
The first time you Flank-Attack an enemy every turn, the attack gains +1d4 damage.
Also, your attacks Flank an enemy if they are pinned against a wall or an obstacle as well.
~Advanced Flank~.Note:
Flanking is when you melee-attack an enemy, and an ally of yours is directly behind the enemy.
Also, instead of an ally being behind the enemy, your attacks count as Flanking even if there is a wall or another obstacle directly behind them.

Starting Abilities Description.Advanced Flank:
Warriors are great at using their teammates and the terrain to make flanking attacks!
When an enemy is caught directly between you and another ally of yours, that attack counts as a Flank Attack, and it deals +1 damage (normally). Your Advanced Flank adds another 1d4 Damage to the first Flank Attack you make every turn!
This works now if there is a wall or an obstacle directly behind your target, so use the environment to your advantage!
Note that this only works for melee attacks and on enemies 1 meter away from you (e.g. enemies directly in front of you).

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization. Every Warrior can choose from the following Warrior specializations
Choices: Fighter, a person specialized in weapon fighting and body-to-body combat
Battlemaster, a heavily trained and armed warrior; master yourself - master the enemy
Barbarian, a crude and battle thirsty warrior, who seeks to shed blood and lives for the fight
Marksman, a precise and mechanical soldier, always finding the best tactic and position; the Marksman wins the battle before it begins

~Upper Hand~.Effect:
Your first attack you make before you move in a turn counts as if it is Flanking, regardless if it would be Flanking normally or not.
If you are wielding a 1-Handed weapon, when you make an attack of opportunity, you can make 2 attacks of opportunity instead (with that weapon).

~Overpower~.Effect: Gain a Half-Action more this turn.

<Might Over Magic>.Effect:
Choose an Advanced spell from the Elemental spell list that deals damage.
You can cast that spell once per Long Rest.
That spell becomes a physical version of itself.
Instead of using magic to cast that spell, you use your body/weapons/tools.
Come up with a description of how it works (see notes).
The damage of that spell becomes Slash, Smash or Pierce, whichever makes sense.
It is not considered a Spell.
<Might Over Magic>.Notes:
E.g. Scorching Rays - you shoot 3 arrows with your bow (Pierce damage).
E.g. Frost Nova - you smash the ground with such force that it damages and slows units around you (Smash damage).
Be creative!

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
When you get this, choose one weapon type.
You have that weapon effect too on all weapons you use, exactly as written, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can change this weapon type on a Long Rest.
<Weaponmaster>.Notes: Pay very close attention to the weapon effect - for example, Katana specifies that you Critical Strike with it when all 3 dice have the same number, so this can only apply to weapons that roll 3 dice. Or, for another example, Slings say that attacks specifically with Slings take 0.33 Actions, so it can not apply to any other weapon!

<Into the Fray>.Effect:
When combat starts, determine which side is your Allied Side and which is the Enemy Side of the battlefield. Each side has a direction (Allied Direction and Enemy Direction).
If you end your turn more to the Allied Direction than you started, you gain 4 Shielding until the start of your next turn.
If you end your turn more to the Enemy Direction than you started, your first attack next turn deals 1d6 extra damage.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Ruining Throw>.Effect:
Throw your weapon at a target and attack it (with the weapon's standard, non-throw damage).
Before applying the damage, the attack destroys all Shielding on the target and removes all buffs on it.
The target is unable to trigger "on roll", can't gain Shielding and can't benefit from Buffs until they spend 1 Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Notes:
Your weapon lands at the nearest space to the target (and you should probably pick it up with a Half-Action).
"On roll" refers to effects like "if it rolls 10 on a d10, the attack deals 1d10 extra damage".
Buffs are all effects that improve the target; even passive effects like auras or passive stats from abilities are negated.
You don't need Training in Throwning and this attack counts as a regular melee attack.

~Solid Defense~.Effect:
Whenever you are attacked (after damage), your Defense is reduced by 1 (if it's more than 0).
Every Long Rest, your Defense resets to its base value and is increased by +1 on top of it.

~Obliterate~.Effect:
Deal bonus damage on top of an attack equal to your current Defense (minimum 0).
Reset your Defense.

<Protect the Meek>.Effect: When an ally within 3 meters of you is targeted by a ranged attack, you become its target instead.

<Bashing Charge>.Effect:
Move 3 meters in a straight line, then choose a target near you.
That target takes 1d8 damage and it must pass a Might Check or be Stunned.

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
When you get this, choose one weapon type.
You have that weapon effect too, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can the weapon type you always know on a Long Rest.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

~Onslaught~.Effect: Whenever YOU kill a worthy enemy, heal for 1d6.

~Reckless Attack~.Effect: After you land an attack, you can deal 2d6 damage to you and also add that damage to the attack.

~Undying Rage~.Effect: Taking damage that would kill you leaves you at 1 Health instead.

<Heartbeat Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
Enter a Heart Trance for 1 minute.
While in Heart Trance, you take 50% less damage from all non-Physical combat damage (except from your own abilities).
When Heart Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Heartbeat Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would take damage.

<Rage Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
Until the end of your next turn, you are immune to Stuns, Slows, Roots, Cripples and being knocked Prone.
Your attacks while in Rage Trance have an extra +1 damage to all attacks.
When Rage Trance ends, heal for 2d6.
<Rage Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would be Crowd Controlled.

<Battle Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 damage.
Enter a Battle Trance that lasts until the end of your next turn.
You gain a protective shield around you which absorbs up to Your Might + Your Level physical damage.
When Battle Trance ends, heal for 2d6, and the shield fades.
<Battle Trance>.Notes: You can activate this as a Reaction when you would take damage.

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see.
Whenever YOU deal damage to it until your next turn, remember the damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes 50% of the damage it has taken in this time period (directly, ignoring Defense).

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must pass a Charisma Check or be Crippled.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

~Marksmanship~.Effect: YOU can flank a target from up to 6 meters away (if you, the target and the ally/wall/obstacle are on the same line).
~Marksmanship~.Notes: As usual, that wall/obstacle/ally helping with your flank must right behind the target (meaning allies can't flank an enemy with you being 6 meters away).

~Reload~.Effect:
Once per turn, you get some damage modifiers to your first attack, depending on the current round:
Your first regular weapon attack in an encounter deals +1 damage.
Your second regular weapon attack in the encounter deals +1d6 damage.
Your third regular weapon attack and all upcoming ones in the encounter deal -5 damage.
You can spend 1 Mana and 0 Actions to 'reset' this Ability to its original state.

~Point Mark~.Effect:
Mark a point on the ground.
Allies and you can use the mark to flank targets.

<Recoil Shot>.Effect:
Dash up to 2 meters away from the target.
Push the target 2 meters away. It takes 1d8 Damage if it collides with something.
<Recoil Shot>.Notes: This does not trigger attacks of oportunity.

<Harpoon>.Effect:
Make a ranged attack that deals 2d12 + Main Stat damage (against Defense).
The target makes a Dexterity Check.
If it fails, it is pulled to you.
Otherwise, you are pulled to it.
<Harpoon>.Notes: Requires a Harpoon, which can be bought for 50 Gold.

<Precise Weapon>.Effect:
Choose any weapon and make it Precise.
The weapon's scaling becomes +4 instead of scaling with a Stat.
The wielder of the weapon is also immune to Cripple and has +1 Movement Speed.
Making another weapon Precise makes the previous back to how it was.

<Ground Aim Lock>.Effect:
Your first attack every turn while Prone deals +1d6 damage.
You can go prone for 0 Actions on your turn.

<Scatterblast>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target for 3d8 + Main Stat Smash damage.
The impact is so powerful that all units within 3 meters of the target take the final damage taken by the target directly, ignoring Defense.
This attack is affected by your Reload state.

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce damage, up to 8 meters.
For each meter to the target over 8 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 8 meters range, the attack deals 8d6 damage. At 7 and 9 meters, it deals 7d6. At 6 and 10 meters, 6d6. And so on.
